info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:29PM EDT until June 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR MOORE...SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE...HARNETT...SOUTHERN GRANVILLE... EASTERN MONTGOMERY...SOUTHERN RANDOLPH...LEE...WAKE...NORTHWESTERN JOHNSTON...CHATHAM...DURHAM AND SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 627 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Franklinton to near Fuquay-Varina to near Sanford to near Biscoe, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 610 PM, a 63 mph gust was measured northwest of Chapel Hill. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Sanford, Southern Pines, Creedmoor, Pittsboro, Lillington and Troy. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
